title: Mexico reports marijuana plantation bust in west, over 72 metric tons of pot destroyed
text:
Mexico reports marijuana plantation bust in west, over 72 metric tons of pot destroyed   Email Print 
MEXICO CITY â€“ Mexican authorities say federal police have destroyed a marijuana plantation containing more than 72 metric tons of plants. 
The National Security Commission says in a statement that the plantation covered a little over 3 acres (about 13,500 square meters). 
It was located in the town of Ixtlan del Rio, in the western Pacific Coast state of Nayarit, and authorities learned of its presence through a citizen tip. 
Photos released by the Commission showed armed officers burning plants in a rural, mountainous area. 
The statement Friday did not mention any arrests. Advertisement
